instructions: Tap Settings . Tap General . Tap Software Update . If the screen indicates an update is available for your iPhone, plug the phone into a power outlet and tap Download and Install.
Tap Settings . Tap General . Swipe to the bottom and tap Reset . Tap Reset Network Settings . If you're asked to confirm that you want to reset these settings, do so.

Tap Settings . Tap Privacy . Tap Location Services . Swipe to the bottom and tap System Services . Move the Wi-Fi Networking & Bluetooth (on some older versions, this is just called Wi-Fi Networking ) slider to the white/Off position.
Tap Settings . Tap General . Swipe to the bottom and tap Reset . Tap Erase All Content and Settings . You'll be asked to confirm that you really want to do this. Confirm and proceed with the reset.
